data.title: AbbVie raises dividend by 5.5%
data.description:
• AbbVie (ABBV) declared $1.73/share quarterly dividend, 5.5% increase from prior dividend of $1.64.
  • Forward yield 3.03%
  • Payable Feb. 17; for shareholders of record Jan. 16; ex-div Jan. 16.
  • See ABBV Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Earnings Snapshot: Dominion Energy tops Q3 estimates; updates FY outlook and reaffirms long-term guidance
Marcus GAAP EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.11, revenue of $210.15M beats by $3.11M
data.description:
• Marcus press release (MCS): Q3 GAAP EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.11.
  • Revenue of $210.15M (-9.7% Y/Y) beats by $3.11M.

data.title: Madison Square Garden GAAP EPS of -$0.37 beats by $0.79, revenue of $39.45M misses by $1.96M
data.description:
• Madison Square Garden press release (MSGS): Q3 GAAP EPS of -$0.37 beats by $0.79.
  • Revenue of $39.45M (-26.0% Y/Y) misses by $1.96M.
  • The combined average season ticket renewal rate for the Knicks and Rangers is approximately 94% for the 2025-26 seasons.

data.title: OpenAI, Oracle to bring Stargate to Michigan
data.description:
OpenAI (OPENAI) and Oracle (ORCL) announced late on Thursday that they will be expanding the Stargate artificial intelligence project and bringing data centers to Michigan.

The Stargate Michigan campus is being developed by real estate development firm Related Digital⁠, OpenAI said, with construction starting early next year. It will use a closed-loop cooling system that “significantly” reduces water consumption and DTE Energy (DTE) will bring energy to the campus using existing excess transmission capacity. 

“The infrastructure and manufacturing needed to advance AI give us a real chance to reindustrialize⁠ the country, and it should happen in places like Michigan,” OpenAI said in a statement. “AI will unlock major benefits—from better healthcare to improved public services—and the buildout required to get there will generate significant opportunities along the way. We're investing through Stargate to help ensure communities across the country benefit both from building AI infrastructure and from all of the progress that AI itself makes possible.”

The Michigan data center campus is the seventh Stargate project announced in the U.S., along with sites in Texas and elsewhere.

When combined, Stargate will have more than 8 gigawatts of planned capacity and see more than $450B in investment over a span of the next three year, OpenAI added.

data.title: Intesa Sanpaolo S.p.A. reports Q3 results
data.description:
• Intesa Sanpaolo S.p.A. press release (ISNPY): Q3 recorded net interest income of €3,680m, down 3.2% from €3,800m in Q2 2025 and down 6.6% from €3,942m in Q3 2024.
  • Net income of €2,372m in Q3 2025 is compared with €2,601m in Q2 2025 and €2,401m in Q3 2024.

data.title: AGCO Non-GAAP EPS of $1.35 beats by $0.13, revenue of $2.47B in-line
data.description:
• AGCO press release (AGCO): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $1.35 beats by $0.13.
  • Revenue of $2.47B (-5.0% Y/Y) in-line.
  • Full-year adjusted earnings per share outlook increased to approximately $5.00
  • $300 million in share repurchases to commence in the fourth quarter of 2025, utilizing $230 million in after-tax proceeds received from the TAFE ownership sale

data.title: Lufax appoints co-CEO
data.description:
China-based financial services company Lufax Holding (LU) announced on Friday the appointment of Xiang Ji as co-CEO with immediate effect.

Shares were +1.07% pre-market to $2.83.

Most recently, Ji served as global managing partner overseeing Asia retail banking business at McKinsey & Consulting Company.

data.title: Cboe Global Markets Non-GAAP EPS of $2.85 beats by $0.32, revenue of $605.5M beats by $13.14M
data.description:
• Cboe Global Markets press release (CBOE): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $2.85 beats by $0.32.
  • Revenue of $605.5M (+13.8% Y/Y) beats by $13.14M.
  • Increases 2025 Organic Total Net Revenue Growth Target2 to 'low double-digit to mid-teens' from 'high single-digit'; Increases Cboe Data Vantage Organic Net Revenue Growth Target to 'high single-digit to low double-digit' from 'mid to high single-digit'
  • Decreases 2025 Adjusted Operating Expense Guidance2 to $827 to $842 million, from $832 to $847 million

data.title: More candy discounts ahead of Halloween, but consumers remain wary
data.description:
Retailers have been discounting candy ahead of Halloween to boost sales amid weaker consumer spending and still-high cocoa prices.

Halloween discounts on candy brands began earlier this year to draw consumers, and were deeper and covered more products than a year ago, Reuters reported, citing Datasembly.

Hershey (HSY) was among food companies with the highest volume of discounted products in the four weeks to October 4 compared to last year, according to a recent report by Jefferies.

In prepared remarks on Thursday, Hershey's (HSY) CEO Kirk Tanner said the Halloween season began slower than anticipated, likely influenced by warmer weather and more seasonal purchases in the final week due to Halloween occurring on a Friday.

Hershey (HSY) raised candy prices by double-digits on average this summer, although Halloween candy was not included in the price hike.

Candy is on average 10.8% more expensive this Halloween season compared to last year, according to an analysis from think tanks Groundwork Collaborative and The Century Foundation, citing NielsenIQ data.

"These price increases are a direct result of Trump's tariffs," the analysis noted, with most cocoa and cocoa products facing tariffs between 15% and 39%.

Mondelez (MDLZ) CEO Dirk Van de Put said some of the company's recent promotions have not been as effective as hoped, and sales slowed as consumers are "very concerned in general about the economy, frustrated with the pricing they're seeing."
